results.title: [Reperfusion syndrome after direct myocardial revascularization on beating heart in patients with ischemic heart disease. Possibilities of prevention with amlodipine].
results.text_hl: Possibilities of secondary prevention of @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@reperfusion syndrome@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ was assessed in 46 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ (39 with class III-IV @DISEASE_Angina_Pectoris @DISEASE_MESH:D000787 @@@angina@@@ after @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ and 7 with non @DISEASE_Acute_Coronary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D054058 @@@ST elevation acute coronary syndrome@@@).

citations.NLM: Tepliakov AT, Dzhavadova GK, Akhmedov ShD, Kandinskiĭ ML, Vesnina ZhV. [Reperfusion syndrome after direct myocardial revascularization on beating heart in patients with ischemic heart disease. Possibilities of prevention with amlodipine]. Kardiologiia. 2003;43(10):45-9. PMID: 14593355

results.title: Comparative effects of calcium and potassium channel modulators on ischemia/reperfusion injury in the isolated rat heart.
results.text_hl: The aim of this study was to examine and compare the effects of the acute administration of @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ or @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ as representatives of the calcium channel blockers or @CHEMICAL_Nicorandil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020108 @@@nicorandil@@@ as a representative of the mitochondrial ATP-dependent potassium (KATP) channel opener to cardiac contractility, coronary flow, and oxidative stress markers on @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@ischemia/reperfusion injury@@@ in the isolated @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ heart.

citations.NLM: Simonovic N, Jakovljevic V, Jeremic J, Finderle Z, Srejovic I, Nikolic Turnic T, Milosavljevic I, Zivkovic V. Comparative effects of calcium and potassium channel modulators on ischemia/reperfusion injury in the isolated rat heart. Mol Cell Biochem. 2019 Jan;450(1-2):175-185. PMID: 29922947

results.title: The effects of amlodipine on the biochemical and histopathological changes in the rabbit ileum subjected to ischemia-reperfusion.
results.text_hl: The @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@I/R damage@@@ was ameliorated by @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ pretreatment, as evidenced by histopathological analysis.

citations.NLM: Coskun AK, Gunal A, Halici Z, Oral A, Seyrek M, Bayir Y, Kilic C, Yigit T, Ozer T, Uzar AI. The effects of amlodipine on the biochemical and histopathological changes in the rabbit ileum subjected to ischemia-reperfusion. Eurasian J Med. 2011 Apr;43(1):33-8. PMID: 25610157

results.title: Ca2+ concentrations are key determinants of ischemia-reperfusion-induced apoptosis: significance for the molecular mechanism of Bcl-2 action.
results.text_hl: Eighteen Wistar @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were divided into sham-operated control group (I) (n = 6), @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@reperfusion@@@ group (II) (n = 6), and @<m>CHEMICAL_Amlodipine</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@-treated group (1 mg kg(-1) body weight/daily by oral route for 7 days before inducing @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@-@<m>DISEASE_Reperfusion_Injury</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015427 @@@reperfusion@@@ maneuver) (III) (n = 6).

citations.NLM: Chattopadhyay P, Chaudhury P, Wahi AK. Ca2+ concentrations are key determinants of ischemia-reperfusion-induced apoptosis: significance for the molecular mechanism of Bcl-2 action. Appl Biochem Biotechnol. 2010 Apr;160(7):1968-77. PMID: 19763897
citations.BibTeX: @article{19763897, title={Ca2+ concentrations are key determinants of ischemia-reperfusion-induced apoptosis: significance for the molecular mechanism of Bcl-2 action.}, author={Chattopadhyay P and Chaudhury P and Wahi AK}, journal={Appl Biochem Biotechnol}, volume={160}, number={7}, pages={1968-77}}
